snippet: Jordanian analysts and Islamists estimate that 800 to 1,200 Jordanians have gone to fight in Syria, more than double the number who fought in Afghanistan or Iraq.
abstract: Jordanian analysts and Islamists estimate that 800 to 1,200 Jordanians have gone to fight in Syria, more than double the number who fought in Afghanistan or Iraq; many fighters are driven by Syrian government's extreme violence and sense that the world is doing nothing to stop it; at same time, they see Syria as a launching pad for their project to erase the region's borders, found an Islamic state and impose Shariah law.

byline.contributor: Rana Sweis contributed reporting from Zarqa.

lead_paragraph: Jordanian analysts and Islamists estimate that 800 to 1,200 Jordanians have gone to fight in Syria, more than double the number who fought in Afghanistan or Iraq.

headline.main: In Jordan Town, Syria War Inspires Jihadist Dreams
